website_summaries.verdict: This reusable product works well and gets better and softer the more you wash it.
pros: This diaper is a long-term solution for urination problems or to keep on hand for when a female dog is in heat
Can be used with a pad inside
Tends to stay on better than some of the other diapers available
The product actually gets more absorbent with each washing
cons: These diapers are not designed to work for fecal incontinence

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product and price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product and price! Allows my senior dog to have a less stressful day because this diaper with a woman's maxi pad cut in two makes for the perfect solution!
customer_reviews.author: carol a ogloza

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Female Dog in Heat!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about these reusable daisy dukes (we don't call them diapers because we only use them for heat cycles). They fit Libby perfectly and are very adjustable with the velcro fasteners and the elastic in the waist. The opening for the tail also fit Libby perfectly. I just put a women's light day mini pad in the bloomers and that works like a charm. I washed and dried them numerous times with very little shrinkage. These are superior other brands. I know because I purchased the other brands first. Very durable. Highly recommend. A++.
customer_reviews.author: S. Zollner

customer_reviews.title: Fit fine, but doesn't absorb squat
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these for 2 of my dogs. One "dribbles" when sleeping (17 lb Boston Terrier) and the other full on pees when he's mad (25 lb bulldog/boston terrier mix). The diapers don't absorb either of these type of pees, so I actually bought some baby diapers and put those on first, then these dog diapers. Now I don't have any pee spots! Both of my dogs are boys and these covered their wieners, but you still have to make sure they are tucked in. Dog ownership is so glamorous, I know.
customer_reviews.author: MaryElizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size- Must buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought quite a few at the pet store was hesitant because it has been hard to find one small enough for my Chihuahua that is 3.5 pounds. This one fit absolutely perfect and I love the color! I had this brand on my last chihuahua and I was not able to find it at any pet store so I was ecstatic to find it on Amazon and that it was perfect fit! All the others did not stay on her and just fell off, I cannot say enough about this one its a must buy!!!!! Trust me I have pretty much tried out all of them.
customer_reviews.author: amy h.

customer_reviews.title: Fits 67 LB, 7 Month Old German Shepherd.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old german shepherd had her first period and this diaper, used together with a women's pad worked perfectly. The diaper stayed in place even after a lot movement. All thanks to the well stitched velcro. We used treats to keep the dog calm the very first time we put it on, afterwards, it was a very simple procedure. All in all, a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 01010100 my world.

customer_reviews.title: Stays on best I’ve found not absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Baby diapers fell off. Dog disposables fell off. For the most part this stays on. We’ve been using it a week and I bought a 3rd-it comes tomorrow. I use a maxi pad inside. My dog is 16, 17 lbs with a bladder cyst causing frequent urgency. Doesn’t work great when I do see her go out and she comes back in with Pooh on it. It is not absorbent at all but it’s the best thing I have found to actually stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Roni Crawford

customer_reviews.title: it could be more absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: diaper barely fits my small chihuahua. he is male and the male diaper he takes off so i went with a female diaper.it stays On. he still pees in it.absorbent for 1 pee only and is a little small.if you have a chihuahua or similar size and using this for a male,get small.xtra small is a little extra extra short around his package.and he can still poop while wearing.Great fir housetraining with time.
customer_reviews.author: momma bear

customer_reviews.title: i should have gotten a extra small but a small fit fine for guests to come over and get her excited ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Yorkie who is 5 or 6 pounds and has a very tiny waist, i should have gotten a extra small but a small fit fine for guests to come over and get her excited that she tinkles. If you want a permanent fit i would go for a xs if you have my size of dog. The small sags on my dog after a few min in wiggling in it. But it soaked up everything and no leaks and it was very comfortable on her!
customer_reviews.author: Pete H.

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, & Super Easy to put on & clean
customer_reviews.text: Crazy easy to use. We just add a half piece of a panty liner & bam SUPER EASY Cleanup. Actually bought a 2nd so when the 1st gets soiled you are never without one. Only precaution is when drying try not to use high heat as will shrink a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoBug

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing.
customer_reviews.text: My purchase might be somewhat unique in that it was for a male dog, suffering from growing rectal incontinence. I would utilize, maxi pads (with adhesive wings), to minimize fouling the diaper. The fit for an approximately 60lb dog was less than optimum. I would recommend to the manufacturer to increase the size of the diaper overall, and to improve the waist fitting of the diaper so as to not require the unit to be so tight on the animal. I'm sure they would counter by saying it might leak as a result. In my case, since it's mission was not for urine, the tighter fit led to leakage around the tail hole.
customer_reviews.author: Impulsebuyer

customer_reviews.title: Fits well and stays put. I have diaper covers ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits well and stays put. I have diaper covers from Simple Solution as well and thought that's what I'd ordered, but this actually has a built in pad of some type so you don't have to use a diaper under it. My girl wears an XL in the diaper covers but could probably use a L, and a L in this product fits just right. She's a 60lb pit bull mix with a narrow waist. She has minor incontinence and I usually stick a pad in this when she wears it--I don't think it would hold a lot of liquid but haven't tested it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Felton

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick.
customer_reviews.text: My dog's first heat was much less gross than I was expecting because of these. I actually bought this pair, and two from petsmart and the quality of this is way better. Plus, just because I have a female dog, does not mean I only want to put her in pinks and purples, petsmart. This has a thicker lining in the more prone area to get gross, but it is not waterproof, and you should probably not use it alone if there's actually something you want to not get all over your house. After trying the same brand diaper liners, I discovered that I was much better off using pads I bought at a convenience store.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey C.

customer_reviews.title: Doggy diapers - never thought I'd be writing a review for this product!
customer_reviews.text: Beats the hell out of the dog Pampers I had to buy at the pet store because I needed them immediately. My only issue is that my dog is thick. She's not fat, she's just built like a barrel, so I have to be careful with the velcro placement. BUT this works so much better than the disposable dog diapers because it fits so much better. I have yet to try it with the femcare products because my dog's issue has been taken care of for the time being, but I definitely recommend this over the other options.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: saving our hardwood
customer_reviews.text: Our elderly dog weighed up to 85 lbs in her prime but is down to about 65-70, deep chest with skinny waist. This large size fits great. It does slip towards her tail a bit, but she doesn't have much of a butt with sleek thin coat. No leaks when she goes in it. But we do stuff in some paper towel to help soak up some of the urine. (Not because it's leaked, but less urine to deal with) Washes well and hang dry as directed. Great quality, holding up well after multiple washes. Just over a week to receive it just before holidays.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wan

customer_reviews.title: Good Doggie Diapers
customer_reviews.text: With a rough collie, needed the larger size based on weight. These fit more comfortably and we use a poise pad inside to help with absorbency. With a larger dog, just the diaper is NOT enough. Easy fix with the pads.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Almost a Winner.
customer_reviews.text: XL fit our Lab puppy better than even custom made britches EXCEPT is it really rocket science that large dogs need a large tail hole? The tail hole was not anywhere near the needed opening but we took a shot by cutting the opening ourselves, just shy of the hole circumference stitching, removing all of the elastic. Worked for us. but come on manufacturer, think!
customer_reviews.author: EdC

customer_reviews.title: easy to put on and truly washable but if your ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made, easy to put on and truly washable but if your dog is incontinent as opposed to just leaking in the night or throughout the day, these do not absorb enough pee and you will have some serious leakage. The smalls fit my mini dachshund perfectly but I have to have her wear diapers as well now. I can use these as an alternate to the cover ups this company also makes. They do help to keep her from removing the diapers. Wish they had a way to insert a disposable pad so I could use these alone but even then, true incontinence needs a lot of absorption!
customer_reviews.author: G. Stants

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Having several enables me to keep them running through the wash and always have one available. I close the velcro before washing them so they don’t get caught on other things
customer_reviews.author: DJW

customer_reviews.title: Product Quality & construction very good/  BUT sizing way off..
customer_reviews.text: In the specs/in the package description as well as the chart shown/when compared to actual measurements on the dog/ Bought X-small for 6 lb Chi / measured 12 in tummy / tried on and it is way too tight as well as NO coverage where it should be/ Measured him from belly to anus/tail He is 8 inches ... this is only 6 inches to the tail opening/ that does not solve the problem as he would squirting a direct shot of urine to up under his own body/ ............ His Mama bought a SMALL Band only /same company/ at WM and had to return as that not correct waist either/ way too tight/
customer_reviews.author: Baby Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good fit on even tiny dogs but requires liner
customer_reviews.text: I have a tiny (3.5 lb) dog who sprays everything all the time, even immediately after going outside. I find that this diaper was the most effective for this tiny dog who has a very large...er...member! The diaper is reasonably wide and the fit is solid because of the elastic. The velcro is very secure which dissuades my little guy from removing it. The product has three drawbacks: it holds very little liquid alone and is NOT waterproof, so you must use it with a liner. I find that a long feminine product with "wings" works the best. Also, the diaper looks ridiculous with its saggy appearance. Silly-looking or not, it does the trick and my drapes are thankful!
customer_reviews.author: RLR

customer_reviews.title: Best product for dog owners ;)
customer_reviews.text: I trained my little dog to use a pee pad but she would stand on the pee pad and pee off the side! I was constantly having to clean my carpets to remove the tiny pee stains. This product was the perfect thing to end all the cleaning. I put a small poise pad inside the diaper and when she has too pee at night she goes to the pad and of course pees off the side but the diaper catches all of it. I then change her pad and she is fresh and clean and so is my carpet! Also, she looks so cute in her little pink diaper ;)
customer_reviews.author: Lu C

customer_reviews.title: Quality!  Fits!  Buying More
customer_reviews.text: This was the 3rd product brand I tried in pup pants. It fits perfectly on my Aussie. Finally! Love it. It works perfectly for small leaks. Overnight, the garment gets saturated along with the liner, but appears to keep all the moisture (no wet bed). I will need to buy more of these so I'm not washing the same pants every single day. Highly recommend this for Standard Aussies. My very embarrassed old girl seems relieved and happy with dignity restored.
customer_reviews.author: Frau Geeze

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent and stand up to repeated washing
customer_reviews.text: I used these on my older senior female dog when she was having incontinence issues. They work well on their own, but I started to use a sanitary napkin as backup for the occasions when she would walk outside and pee on her own, wearing the diaper. They stand up to repeated washings. I usually like dry so did not throw them in the dryer a lot, which may have contributed to their longevity. I also used the Simple Solution disposable diapers for situations where we were on the road and didn't have access to a washing machine for several days.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Weigel

customer_reviews.title: Love these dog diapers
customer_reviews.text: I been using these for My old female Labrador who is now 12 and turning grey and is having trouble keeping it in and leaking here and there, this diaper is perfect I would not change a thing with this product it's very easy to put on and stays on until I take it off and it is easy to clean just drop in the washer. It saves me cleaning time as well as saving my from the pee smell. They look so comfortable I love my old dog and she will be using these and nothing else
customer_reviews.author: Nugget

customer_reviews.title: May not be for aging dogs with serious problems...
customer_reviews.text: In all fairness, I didn't expect this to solve my problem with an elderly dog who lost bowel control during sleep, but I hoped it would help. Unfortunately, she pulled it off as soon as possible (not the fault of the product), but it was not absorbent enough to absorb the leakage when she didn't. I think her swollen belly made the diaper not fit as well, also. I hate to give this a bad review because it might work for others. Just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: You're getting exactly what you expect with this item. My 60lb German Shepherd puppy surprised us with her first heat and this diaper has saved us. They stay on her body nicely, not riding down or fitting too tightly around her legs or tail. Place a stayfree pad inside and we're good to go until the next time we go outside. She still plays normally with them on, not seeming to mind them much. We even been allowing her to sleep in the bed with us again and have had no leakage through the whole night. Only thing that could make it better is if there was a better color.
customer_reviews.author: kristin

customer_reviews.title: inaccurate sizing
customer_reviews.text: Pretty dissatisfied with this product. We have a pug Pekingese mix who is on the older side and is now having problems holding his urine, he is considered a small breed but when we bought the small wraps they were way too tight and hurt his stomach and his man parts so we purchased a medium and it was huge, it literally falls off and looks like a tutu on him. If the company could get the sizing ralight I would rate this 5 stars and have no complaints but maybe some suggestions on different colors lol
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: although our dog hates wearing diapers, for us it comes very handy because she has urine problems so she goes and lays down everywhere next thing you know there's a wet spot. Poor baby I know but this product is well recommended
customer_reviews.author: Lineth CL

customer_reviews.title: Good price.temporary.
customer_reviews.text: My chi slides it right off after 20 min.and it is not waterproof. It absorbed it.but wet on your hand.heck of a time getting it on after it slides off.he isnt happy.
customer_reviews.author: momma bear

customer_reviews.title: Stayed in place and absorbed decent amount.
customer_reviews.text: We used these for my elderly dog who was having accidents overnight in her bed. We sometimes added a pad in with it overnight as well. However the diaper worked great and didn't leak and we liked them so much we are going to keep just in case we need to use in the future with our other animals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A simple solution!
customer_reviews.text: I have a little yorkie that has accidents sometimes when my workday runs long. We have several and I put one of these on her each day before I leave. If she wets one I can just hose it off, let it dry outside and then toss it in the washer when I have a few to clean. She's less than six pounds but it seems to hold a lot, I think she often wets them more than once. I much prefer this to puppy pads or crating.
customer_reviews.author: annawashere

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE of sizing!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 50-ish pound husky, who is 8 months old. The XL just barely fit her. I bought the size large at the pet store (that's the largest size they have), and they REALLY don't quite fit her - the sides come un-velcroed if she stretches too much or moves too much. So I came online to buy the largest size available (XL). These ones fit her better... but barely fit her. :-/ I guess I need to buy the re-useable diapers with liners, to find a diaper that fits her.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaving product.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it will do and the sizing is generally correct if you know the wt of your dog. Bigger is better if in doubt. Getting female maxipads is a great idea and cheap. These are NOT water proof but it nowhere does it say that they are. This is a much better price than you will find in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the small size. They work great on our aging Yorkie poo. Like some other reviewers suggested, we purchased light feminine pads at fraction of the cost of the pet pads. After several washings, they are starting to show a little wear, but I wouldn't hesitate to buy replacements.
customer_reviews.author: TheBigDog

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is inaccurate and costly to return.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 2 stars cos it is smaller than it describes. And because of that I've had to spend USD35 to ship it back just to return it. Its not fair to the consumers. The sizing chart and package says 22-35" my dog is about 28-30" but it does not fit at all. The velcro tears apart as soon as he wiggles a little. I previously bought Simple Solution Washable Male Wrap in Large which also fits 18-35" and it fits well. So I'd thought this was a safe buy.
customer_reviews.author: monsterb

customer_reviews.title: Good for incontinence, not so much for an ill-trained dog
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my dog thinks using the bathroom in the house is fair game. He'll sometimes run back in the house from outside to specifically defecate in the foyer. I got this to force him to hold it until he's let out. He's peed himself a time or two and this absorbed it. However, he is able to defecate through the tail opening, so, I actually had to narrow it somewhat. I think it's helping him learn where it's ok to go because even when he's out of the diaper we're having less problems.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Best thing we tried!
customer_reviews.text: I tried disposable doggy diapers for my dog and they were terrible. They fell off all the time and were rather expensive. I even tried modifying regular baby diapers by cutting out a tail hole. That was cheaper, but they still fell off. This diaper wrap is fantastic. Don't bother getting the liners as they are simply inexpensive feminene pads which you can buy anywhere. I recommend the kind meant for nights because they are thicker. Overall, this diaper wrap stays on, looks nice and my dog doesn't mind wearing it. I think the denim color looks quite good with my dog's black hair (much better than a white disposable diaper!).
customer_reviews.author: Ash W

customer_reviews.title: Really Works highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: They honestly work. I have a Male puppy and this is a great way to have him be apart of the whole house and family without working about cleaning up pee. This would be great for a puppy or a SR doing that cant hold it .. A++++
customer_reviews.author: running

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job of holding liners in place - can't use them for incontinence without a liner.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I have a shepherd/collie mix - large dog. This product (usually) doesn't leak but I use adult incontinence pads - over night super absorbency and they pretty much soak up the urine. These diapers fit well and are adjustable so you can make them fit pretty snug around the waist but they will leak around the legs if you aren't using a liner that will absorb all the urine.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Bane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit just like the chart states . And perfect tail hole size
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly . I really like that the tail hole is actually big enough for my husky’s tail. Other ones I had to cut the whole bigger and then the diaper broke. Love how absorbent it is and doesn’t go through the blue outer layer . Washed and good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana M. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: I had a senior cat who had many frequent accidents ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a senior cat who had many frequent accidents because he could no longer control his bladder (it took us awhile to find out it was a neurological disease after seeing a specialist). So he needed diapers. However he was such a big cat that he needed dog diapers because not even baby ones fit him. This diaper really did the trick. The accidents were now in a controlled area and because it's washable I didn't have to spend a ton of money on disposable ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Will only by these for my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: These work great for our dog who is borderline incontinent. They are very absorbent and with the color it's easy to tell when there was a leak. They also hold up well to repeated use and washing. Unlike the pair I bought at petsmart for twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper ever!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these diapers when my 50lb golden retriever was in heat, and we were staying in a hotel. They worked perfectly. The Velcro is strong, and holds with no problem. The diaper is thick enough to be used without a liner,but also breathable, so it doesn't become too warm. It washes like a dream. I was able to wash out in bathroom sink, and hang to dry. Made it through the trip with just two diapers! Much better and easier than disposables. I bought the XL, and while it worked perfectly on my 50lb dog, I believe the straps are long enough to accommodate a 75-90 lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret R

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory, horrible in practice
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a incontinent 65 pound german shorthair pointer. Pretty severe dripping problem. Material was soft, tabs seemed high quality, but FAILED miserably. Wouldn't stay on (with short tail just slipped off) no matter how tight fastened. When was on with pads inside for absorbency urine just leaked around sides or the tail hole. Was soaked in 20 minutes or so. Highly disappointed. Save your money. Really.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger V.

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T HOLD URINE
customer_reviews.text: My old dog is sometimes incontinent at night. This diaper DOES NOT HOLD URINE, it goes right through it. The package says is becomes more absorbent over time, but not absorbent enough. TIP: Buy the EZwhelp washable dog diapers. I bought these at the same time as the Simple Solution diaper, and the pee does not go through; the diaper holds it in. PRO? I like the color; it is a good contrast to my dog's black fur. It fits well.
customer_reviews.author: luv.ej

customer_reviews.title: Good brand. I use the wraps and diapers.
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, stays in place. Rarely have a leak. I add a human depends to the lining, they absorb more and wick urine away from skin.
customer_reviews.author: maknelson

customer_reviews.title: I Love This product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my female German Shepherd for when she is in heat. My shepherd is small for her breed and the large size fits perfectly. If you have a larger Shepherd I would buy the xtra large size. I love this product. a mini pad attaches nicely and I just replace the pad when it gets soiled It is effective and comfortable for my dog. She doesn't mind it and it stays in place during play and sleep. Fits my dog a little better than the cover up but I tried them both and both work great.
customer_reviews.author: Tia&bobsmom

customer_reviews.title: Fits my lab - she's 74 lbs - does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have a yellow lab that sometimes has incontinence. She wears these well and they can hold a good deal of urine. I usually rinse them out before throwing them in the washing machine. They wash well too. I usually let them air dry, but I have put them in the dryer as well. I own two of them. I have had one of them for a year and the other for about four months. They are both still in really good condition. They get used about twice a month (as needed). Both of them came in teal.
customer_reviews.author: airborne82girly

customer_reviews.title: Needs extra support for urine incontinence
customer_reviews.text: These are not good for incontinence by themselves. I learned this the hard way when my geriatric dog still managed to wet the carpet with it on. I use Tena Heavy incontinence pads in the diaper and it works great together. My dog is annoyed slightly by it, but not enough to cause her discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Good job Simple
customer_reviews.text: I was going crazy without them. My dog is 12 years old and has incontinence so something had to be done. I put panti liners inside the diaper which helps a lot. She does not mind the diaper and it is very soft around her legs. Good job Simple Solutions
customer_reviews.author: D. MCCAY

customer_reviews.title: Not great for a male dog
customer_reviews.text: I was desperate to find a solution for my male dog who was marking when left alone. Unfortunately, these weren't it. It didn't cover his parts, but also they slipped down almost immediately. I found the same thing happen to male belly bands. I ended up cutting a pair of my own tights and pinning them to a shirt that finally did the trick. With that being said, the quality seemed fine.
customer_reviews.author: E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: 55 lb Black Lab/ Border Collie Mix; Fits great.
customer_reviews.text: 55 lb older black lab/ border collie mix with some tinkle issues. The Extra large fit her great. Washes well. Only complaint is the tail hole is elastic so it fits really snug and with out girl Wednesday having a big bushy tail it can be uncomfortable for her. Otherwise, great products.
customer_reviews.author: Heather T.

customer_reviews.title: Good item but....
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog that's 14 years old and she pees quite a lot on my floor, the diaper was able to hold the urine but after a while it looks like it was going to overflow (the wetness shows on the outside of the supposed absorbing area) I had to handwash it and air dry it real quick (she has a hard time holding in) but I was too late.... This product is good for a dog that can hold its pee in longer then old dogs but I would recommend something more absorbent or a package with more then one Diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Ayanna

customer_reviews.title: Solve the problem ...well almost.
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend has a 15 year old blind puddle that urinates everywhere in her apartment, we bought two diapers in order to interchange them regularly so she always has one clean and dry , but the little dog pees too much and the diapers cannot retain that much liquid ....so to fix that issue we put feminine sanitary towels inside the diapers and now it seems that the problem is solved. Consider that drawback I still recommend these diapers,
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Our 15 year old 25lb dog urinates like a race horse
customer_reviews.text: Our 15 year old 25lb dog urinates like a race horse. Issue is, this diaper will leak with a heavy soaking. To help mitigate, we started adding a pad/liner which helps with absorption. The diaper does its job about 95% of the time, but there is certainly room for soakage improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Loving

customer_reviews.title: A well-designed, eco-friendly product
customer_reviews.text: Diapers with a tail-hole took a little getting used to for our 12-year old cattledog mix, who has been leaky since she was 5. (homeopet's "Leaks-no-more" helped when she was younger.) I like that they are washable, and we can use compostable pads inside. A tip: wash them with the straps attached -- that much velcro in the dryer can snag clothing and collect a lot of lint. Another tip: buy two if you have a dog who soaks through her bed. You'll want one for the wash, one to wear.
customer_reviews.author: cavenoid

customer_reviews.title: Great product, well-made, soft.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Simple Solution wrap for my senior male dog years ago and they worked nicely. This time I needed the female garment and the product works well with her. I bought the Large and it fit my 40lb Australian Shepherd dog fine. I think the elastic really helps to make it fit nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my olde english bulldogg, Georgia who is 70 pounds for her last heat cycle before I spayed her. They fit perfectly, are washable, well made, stay in place with the adjustable velcro strap. This was the best purchase ever. If you need these, please don't go with any other brand you will love these!
customer_reviews.author: Crissy55

customer_reviews.title: This appears to be well made, and was purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be well made, and was purchased for my male pug. He has some issues with his bum, and that was the issue we hoped to address with this product. While it does seem to fit as intended, the hole for his tail is too large to solve our particular problem. I believe that if this is to be used for most other issues, this diaper would be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution for us
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for us. We put in a panty liner so we could swap that out frequently and not have to wash the diaper daily. This was the perfect solution for our dog that went into heat.
customer_reviews.author: Cedarrose1

customer_reviews.title: Don't like headlines!
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice and better made than most. My only complaint are 1: the Velcro doesn't extend far enough on either side when using and the leg opening gets wider as the waist line slips down. And 2: there's not enough padding in the crotch. I have to cut a pad in half and add it to keep urine from soaking him.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: They are made well. My Doberman has a very small docked tail, so the pants really try to slide off of her rear end without a tail to go through the hole and help hold them up. The tail hole ends up down below her tail just above her vulva. I have to fasten them on very tightly around the waist to keep them from sliding, but I suppose this will always be an issue keeping pants on any breed with no tail.
customer_reviews.author: NPC#6,669Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the large for my dog, she sits right at 40lbs. The large ended up being just a tad too big but it still works, but the medium would have been a better fit. Overall it works good for small leakage during the night. I order the liners to go with it and we haven't had any problems anymore.
customer_reviews.author: RDS

customer_reviews.title: It's useless unless I buy several of these and constantly wash ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it has rave reviews, however, my 12 year old basset, soaks through this thing after one pee, and that's even after I've put TWO pads inside! It's useless unless I buy several of these and constantly wash them. Might as well just buy the disposable kind. Disappointed. I'm really tired of all the pee.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made held urine good just didnt stay on well i.may of bough wrong size
customer_reviews.author: connie Stambaugh

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: These work great for my little geriatric dog. She hates wearing them but they actually stay on well & I've had no leaks so far. If anything, sizing might be off because she's only 17lbs but wears a large.
customer_reviews.author: I. marin

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: wish they had other colors like i found last buy. I will keep looking I guess. Problem is the dog not the diapers. She will take them off when no one is looking...She is a nudist at heart I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Elle's Mom

customer_reviews.title: This washable diaper fits my Pomeranian Terrier mix female. ...
customer_reviews.text: This washable diaper fits my Pomeranian Terrier mix female. She is house broken, but since she is a rescue that was spayed later in life, she has a problem marking territory. This washable diaper gives me peace of mind by allowing her to roam house and not be locked away in cage because she can't be trusted that she may pee on objects. Sorry Cesar Milan...
customer_reviews.author: Cessna89811

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our standard poodle who only has really small accidents when excited or nervous. Great for travel, visiting family, in the car or when we are expecting guests. Comfortable feel and washes well. I persobally love the teal color.
customer_reviews.author: Flappyjack

customer_reviews.title: Used it for my male lab that was having incontinence problems and it was not quite "long" enough to cover his "man" parts comfor
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly large enough for a LARGE dog. Used it for my male lab that was having incontinence problems and it was not quite "long" enough to cover his "man" parts comfortably, it worked but it was a stretch...literally.
customer_reviews.author: HonestReviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent doggy diaper
customer_reviews.text: This diaper stayed on my dog. They didn't leak and I love to have no problems with a product. I started with an extra small and had to move to the small, but that was my fault for guessing my Yorkie was smaller then she was. I guess the extra small was for Chihuahuas. The small fits perfectly. If someone is looking for a diaper for their dog these are the ones. The disposable I tried would never stay on my Yorkie.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Also the velcro is only like two inches on the very end the corners of ...
customer_reviews.text: It had to be washed throughout her heat, obviously, but the straps stretched out so now its about as tight as it can go due to the velcro. Also the velcro is only like two inches on the very end the corners of the straps so the part of the diaper that isnt being held by the velcro fall through the straps. I doubt it will last through another heat cycle for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Marie

customer_reviews.title: The BEST diapers
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love these diapers. We’ve purchased a few of them but have always come back to these to the point that we only use these now! I have a 70lbs german shepherd and we buy the xl
customer_reviews.author: StephMarie

customer_reviews.title: BEST DOG DIAPER OUT THERE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these! Thicker and better Velcro and half a kotex inside it and you're set for accidents. My little Yorkis doesn't mind them at all. She is doing MUCH BETTER getting housebroken but has stubborn streaks so I leave them on inside. She's worth it! She was a rescue and I just love her.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: washable diaper
customer_reviews.text: My pup wore this until she was fully potty trained. She is a smaller cocker and for her to wear without additional pad, it got soaked easily, so it's necessary for a feminine pad cut in half to aid in holding moisure in. If you buy this particular type, you really need more than one as it gets wet faster than other brands I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miracle

customer_reviews.title: Okay Purchase
customer_reviews.text: These worked just okay. Our English Shepard is about 48 lbs. Although I got large it would have helped if it was a bit bigger. Note, our dog is a female and I needed to use 2 max pads with it for each use. We used it exclusive for the night. He problem was just leaking.
customer_reviews.author: J Walter

customer_reviews.title: Almost fall off our lab
customer_reviews.text: There is only a small piece of velcro on the straps. Our lab is fit and has a nice waist so when we secure the diaper, the straps connect a couple inches up on the body of the diaper leaving nothing to hold for first couple inches in place. Due to this condition, the bottom couple of inches on both sides slide back and you end up continually pulling them back up. I don't think they would fall off but an extra couple of inches on the straps would help a lot.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyB

customer_reviews.title: The diaper is very nice, absorbent material on it's own
customer_reviews.text: The diaper is very nice, absorbent material on it's own. Well put together and seems to be a quality item. However it kept slipping down due to the fact that my Doberman does not have a tail to hold it up I think. When pulled up it seemed to sit where it should, so I don't think I got the wrong size. I will have to keep looking for something that will stay up.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i needed for my petite German Shepard during her heat cycle. I was reluctant about the fit but it's great. She doesn't seem to mind it to much so it's not terribly uncomfortable even tho it's foreign to her. Thank goodness i found these or she wouldn't be coming in the house for awhile...
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Mohler

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great and stays on even when dog tried to get off
customer_reviews.author: RebelRoze

customer_reviews.title: Got it on the first try
customer_reviews.text: It fits great but really needs a disposable on underneath for dogs with heavier flow. Would love more color options and we will probably order again.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfling1331

customer_reviews.title: My dog hated to make a mistake and had no problem using ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for a year, placing a depends it in. It added a years plus life as my dog had become incontinent. I rotated three diapers, washed them after each use and replaced them every 6 months. My dog hated to make a mistake and had no problem using them. They did the job admirably!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pet diapers
customer_reviews.text: After using this product and several other reusable pet diapers I have found that baby diapers with a hole cut for the tail work much better and are less expensive. You can buy a variety of sizes and they do not leak. This diaper leaks badly and the area around the legs is not snug. Baby diapers are stretchier, do not leak and seem to be much more comfortable for my pet.
customer_reviews.author: creek777

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for 75 lb rhodesian ridgeback
customer_reviews.text: I intended to buy the disposable ones but bought this on accident. Ended up being really great. The XL fits well on my 75 lb rhodesian ridgeback without slipping off or velcro coming undone.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: It DID however hold her leakage pretty well the one time she left it on long ...
customer_reviews.text: Was small. My girl is about 75 lbs and this did not fit her well. She was also able to get it off after I fell asleep. I don't know if she took it off because it bothered her or because it didn't fit well due to being tight on her back legs and belly. It DID however hold her leakage pretty well the one time she left it on long enough to do so.
customer_reviews.author: kelley

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line, they work! (With an added absorbent pad)
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old sweet girl started wetting her bedding at night a few weeks ago. She is otherwise healthy and happy. These keep her dry through the night. I do add a human poise (or generic equivalent) pad to the diaper. I read that in another review and haven't even tried them without one. I like the idea of the moisture being wicked away from her rather than spreading through the diaper. (50 # standard poodle)
customer_reviews.author: Ang B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and fit..
customer_reviews.text: Fits my little fatty pit bull perfectly. The doggie diapers like to slip off of her too easily and this keeps them secure so we don't have any senior puppy accidents overnight. Plus a fair price for such a quality product..
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. The only drawback is that it tends to slip off the dog. I know I read a review that someone make some type of strap that wrapped around the dog and then they connected it to the diaper garment. It would be nice for may be the company to come up with something that keeps the garment on the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Washable Diaper
customer_reviews.text: Bough extra small and small for two small chihuahuas. They was really well and hold up very good. Use them every day. Sizing runs true.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cumbo

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed straps and velcro. Unless your dog is ...
customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed straps and velcro. Unless your dog is dying of morbid obesity, you'll have to alter the straps with a sewing machine to make the velcro area larger and reduce the length from tail hole to front/top edge. Who designed these things?
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Busch

customer_reviews.title: Ready to go when Pitbull co,es into heat again, so we will see.  Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my dachshund 12 year, he has become incontinent in his od age dribbles, buteverytime I put it on him he slides on the floor and somehow gets it off. I will keep trying to get him to use it. It's the right size so the sizing is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: edAdams

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We use this diaper on our 70 lb female labrador during her heat cycle. When used with a maxi-pad, it handles her discharge easily. When her flow is light, a maxipad isn't needed. The diaper fits well and it's comfortable enough for her to tolerate wearing it. It's easy to put on and take off for her walks. The diaper gets softer when washed without loosing it's shape or absorbancy. All in all, this is a good solution for our need.
customer_reviews.author: Bela Kovacs

customer_reviews.title: My little dog (who looks pretty similar to the one on the picture) figured out ...
customer_reviews.text: My little dog (who looks pretty similar to the one on the picture) figured out VERY quickly that by rubbing up against the bed or couch, she could loosen the Velcro. The product is very good, just not for dogs that refuse the keep the product on
customer_reviews.author: Lafille

customer_reviews.title: Good value for $
customer_reviews.text: The size was just as I wanted. My puppy seemed comfortable enough with it in place. Easy to fit and easy to clean. Held up well.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Best design possible
customer_reviews.text: SO much better than the waist band! I found that the band would slip off extremely easy and I would have a urinating dog wearing what would look to be a speedo. This has the hole for the tail and has 2 velcro straps for the legs, so it's a much more secure fit.
customer_reviews.author: Glitch

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: These work great, but my dog is about 55-60 pounds so I thought they would fit perfect. They are a little tight because she is wide. They still fit, but the XXL fit better. So just because the pounds are right doesn't mean they will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: If I had a 60 pound dog this would work fine. So I would recommend it for a mid ...
customer_reviews.text: Little to small for my 90 Rottie. If I had a 60 pound dog this would work fine. So I would recommend it for a mid side dog.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, thin, and not enough velcro on the strap
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, thin, and not enough velcro on the strap. You definitely need a liner or a pad with these, because there is minimal absorbent material where it should be. If they are slightly big on your dog and you have to cinch them up tightly, the side of the diaper will fall back towards your pup's butt, because the amount of velcro on the strap is only about an inch long and the sides aren't being held by anything.
customer_reviews.author: NewkNewk

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My dog wore it but I didn’t find it got clean easily overall worth the money but looking forward for my dogs upcoming spay.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Houdini Dog
customer_reviews.text: My female black lab kept getting out of the diaper. I finally gave up using.
customer_reviews.author: #FedoraGuy

product_meta.title: Simple Solution Washable Reusable Female Dog Diapers
product_meta.description: Size:MediumSimple Solution Washable Female Dog Diapers are the perfect answer for dogs experiencing excitable urinary, incontinence, or female dogs in heat and puppy training. Each diaper is reusable and lined with a soft plaid flannel fabric for comfort fit as well as an absorbent mesh liner for leakage protection. For light seasonal flow or minor excitable urination, the diapers may be used alone. For heavy seasonal flow or more serious cases of urination, simply attach a Simple Solutions diaper liner to the diaper's built-in mesh liner. Machine washable on gentle cycle, hang to dry. To insure a proper fit for the anatomy of your dog, choose the next size up.
feature_bullets: A SECURE FIT - Simple Solution Washable Medium Diaper for Dogs 15 lb - 35 lb and wasist size of 15 in - 23 in provides super-absorbent, long-lasting protection
SUPER ABSORBENT with MICROFIBER PAD - These reusable dog diapers are made from a microfiber fabric, have a tail hole and repositionable closures to provide a comfortable and secure fit
FUR FRIENDLY - Each washable diaper has a moisture-wicking liner to protect skin and coat, super-absorbent microfiber pad, and a plastic liner for leak protection
LEAK PROTECTION - Great for females in heat, dogs with urinary incontinence, excitable urination or travel
TAIL WAGGING COMFORT - Contains 1 machine-washable diaper per package; for extra added protection use with Simple Solution Disposable Diaper Liners

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
